SEARCH
Package tetris.boards

Class Board

java.lang.Object
tetris.boards.Board
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoardWithPhysics, ReceiverBoard
public abstract class Board extends Object
An abstract representation of a Tetris game board.

This class serves as the root for all specific board implementations (e.g., Single Player, Multiplayer Sender/Receiver). It manages the core components of the game state, including:

  • The game grid (walls, locked blocks).
  • The currently falling piece and the "next" queue.
  • The scoring and leveling system.
  • Rendering logic for the board and its UI elements.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int x, int y, int gridRows, int gridSpawnRows, int gridColumns, int tetrominoesQueueSize, TetrominoesGeneratorType tetrominoesQueueGeneratorType, long seed)
      Initializes the base board structure.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate for the top-left corner of the grid display.
      y - Y coordinate for the top-left corner of the grid display.
      gridRows - Number of visible rows in the grid.
      gridSpawnRows - Number of invisible buffer rows above the grid.
      gridColumns - Number of columns in the grid.
      tetrominoesQueueSize - Number of upcoming pieces to display.
      tetrominoesQueueGeneratorType - The algorithm for generating pieces (e.g., 7-Bag or Random).
      seed - The random seed ensuring deterministic piece generation (crucial for multiplayer).

  • Method Details

    • isFallingTetrominoLocked

      protected abstract boolean isFallingTetrominoLocked()
      Determines if the currently falling tetromino has met the conditions to be locked into the grid (e.g., touched the ground for a specific duration).
      Returns:
      true if the piece should lock, false otherwise.

    • updateFallingTetromino

      protected abstract void updateFallingTetromino()
      Updates the position and state of the falling tetromino. This typically involves applying gravity, processing user input, or interpolating network updates.

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Checks if the game session is still active.
      Returns:
      true if the player has not topped out, false if Game Over.

    • getScore

      public int getScore()
      Gets the current score of the board.
      Returns:
      The integer score.

    • update

      public void update()
      The main game loop for the board.

      This method orchestrates the cycle of: 1. Spawning new pieces from the queue. 2. Checking for immediate spawn collisions (Game Over condition). 3. Updating the falling piece's logic. 4. Calculating the ghost piece position. 5. Locking pieces and processing line clears if necessary.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Renders the complete board state.
      Parameters:
      g2 - The Graphics2D context.

    • setNextTetrominoAsFallingTetromino

      protected void setNextTetrominoAsFallingTetromino()
      Promotes the next tetromino in the queue to become the active falling tetromino. It resets the piece's position to the spawn point (top center) and initializes its shadow.

    • lockFallingTetrominoAndClearLines

      protected int lockFallingTetrominoAndClearLines()
      Commits the falling tetromino to the grid and clears completed lines.

      This method handles the core scoring logic based on the NES scoring system (40/100/300/1200 points per line count). It also updates the level.

      Returns:
      The number of lines cleared in this step.

    • increaseLevel

      protected void increaseLevel()
      Increases the difficulty level of the game. Subclasses can override this to apply side effects (e.g., increasing gravity).

    • drawFallingTetromino

      protected void drawFallingTetromino(Graphics2D g2)
      Renders the falling tetromino. Can be overridden to draw additional elements like the shadow (ghost piece).
      Parameters:
      g2 - The graphics context.
